title: GoPro Telemetry Extractor
description: Online service and complementary tools for extracting, visualizing and interpreting metadata from GoPro cameras: GPS, accelerometer, gyroscope, face recognition... The visualizations are based on D3, and derivative projects use Processing. This is one of the very few implementations of Adobe's mgJSON format for After Effects. 3,000 files converted per month.

title: Chinese culture databases
description: Two comprehensive websites and databases about Chinese cinema and literature translated into Spanish, for the Autonomous University of Barcelona and the Confucius institute of Barcelona. They store and classify thousands of books and movies, along with very comprehensive metadata and images. The sites are server-rendered with Express.js, MongoDB and EJS templates, but can also be accessed via a JSON API.

title: DJI SRT Viewer
description: Visualization tool for SRT flight logs of DJI drones. It supports several devices: Mavic Pro, some Phantoms, Mavic 2... and other common GPS tracking formats such as geoJSON, GPX and KML. The visualization side is built on P5js (based on HTML canvas). Along with the site, some NPM modules were created and open sourced. They allow to parse the files, create GUI elements in P5js and interact with Mapbox's static API.

title: Orbit Simulator
description: With just the use of your fingers and the accelerometer, you can reproduce the laws of gravity. Pinch a planet and flick some asteroids. Make them orbit, merge and collide. Use physical properties to create mesmerizing patterns. This Android game/sandbox app has been downloaded more than 350,000 times.

title: Starry Analytics
description: Load your Google Analytics data and play with the settings to create the world map of your users sessions. With this tool, marketers and clients can visualize the effectiveness of their campaigns or products geographically, while creating beautiful snapshots of their achievements. It was built with P5js (HTML canvas) and Google APIs.

title: React Examples
description: This is a series of microsites, mini-games and proof of concepts made in React. They showcase multiple techniques both of "classic" (class components) and modern (hooks, context, reducers) React.

title: Octagon. The Flying Squirrel
description: You will not survive the 360º runner without turning your phone upside down! Help Octagon, the flying squirrel, escape. in this innovative 3D game you control a flying squirrel by turning your phone in all 360 degrees. It uses the accelerometer and gyroscope of smart phones to deduce orientation. It was downloaded more than 20,000 times.

title: Audio-Assisted Sensory Photography
description: This proof of concept uses stereo images and depth map computation to help blind people explain their world in images, like the rest of us do. The software converts the two parallel images into a 3D map, which is in turn converted into an audio signal that describes the volumes in front of the user. It was created with the budget stereo (3D) webcam Minoru and the Java version of Processing.

title: Creative Coding
description: This is a series of small experiments around coding, data visualization, algorithms, data structures and AI.

title: Dropped My Phone
description: This cheeky app warns you if you —or someone else— drop your phone. It is also a phone throwing game. It relies on a very simple physics model and the fact that smartphones carry an accelerometer sensor. In a nutshell, when the magnitude of the accelerometer vector approaches 0 g, we know the phone is in free fall. By counting the duration of the fall we will also know its length.

title: App Prototyping Barcelona
description: The website you are looking at was build with modern React (context, hooks) and Sass (compiled CSS). Scroll down for more information and contact details
